title: Shared Google Calendar no longer updates
content:
Lightning in Thunderbird works fine with my own Google calendar. On Google I also have read access to my wife's calendar and a public (holidays) calendar, which were both subscribed to in Lightning. Recently both of these calendars have come up empty in Lightning, even though I can still see them in Google.

I therefore tried to unsubscribe and resubscribe to them in Lightning. This appears to be out of date. The illustration doesn't look like what I see in Google.

Nonetheless, by improvising on those instructions, I was able to restore the public (holidays) calendar in Lightning. However, this doesn't work for my wife's calendar. As long as I am logged in to my Google account the URL provided by Google works in Firefox, but no data from her calendar are displayed in Lightning, even though I provided my Google login credentials. Other calendar apps (Apple calendars in iPadOS and MacOS and Outlook calendar in Windows 10) can see her calendar, How can I restore (read-only) access in Lightning?
creator: rsbrux

title: Thunderbird 102 on Windows 11 - Google Calendar not updated, sync doesn't work until restart.
content:
Hi, I hope your day is going well and thank you for taking time to read my topic and question. I'm running Thunderbird 102.6.1, first offered to channel users on December 20, 2022 on Windows 11.

I have a Gmail account with the calendar connected to Thunderbird so, when Thunderbird opens a calendar events is showed on the right. All events are updated since Thunderbird is started but, if as in my case the PC stay tuned on all day and some calendar events are added outside of Thunderbird from smartphone, Thunderbird never update the calendar.

Also opening the calendar with the left bar and try a manual sync never resolve the issue. The only way to update the calendar seems to be exit from Thunderbird and open it again.

Anyone know any solution to have the calendar sync without closing Thunderbird? Thanks in advance.

I have reported this issue in a BUG but I don't expect any help or fix will be done there. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1809023
creator: peopleinside

title: SMTP password problem
content: I am a BT customer, Windows 10, Norton antivirus (via BT), Duckduckgo browser. I have three email acounts with Thunderbird. Recently, I cannot accurately remember the details, I have been unable to send from my default email. It receives mail and the other two accounts send and receive normally. The failed send prompts an error message about SMTP password. I usually use Mozilla prompted passwords but recently manually changed passwords in my BT account whilst trying to resolve the issue. Mail sent from within the MyBT webpage is delivered properly. The settings information for SMTP merely states the password as "the normal password" and I have no idea what it is using. I tried the approach suggested by one respondent of creating a duplicate default address and re-entering the password manually but this was not allowed by the system. I have tried uninstalling and re-installing Thunderbird in the hope that it would update to the correct password but without success. I don't want to delete my default adress for fear of ending up with loss of information. Is there a way of finding what password SMTP is accessing and changing it?
creator: NorJean

title: Thunderbird Files
content:
I changed the 'threads' to "unthread" in a folder. Now half of the files disappeared. They show up as there when I do a search but not when I go into the folder.

From the 'search' feature I tried moving them to another folder. They showed up in the new search but not in the new folder.

Help, please.

~ Peggy from Porcupine
creator: peggyfromporcupine

title: hard time seeing and reading the computer screen
content:
Hello,

Last month I wrote about an issue I have. I have had a stroke, and sometimes reading the computer screen is difficult for me. I was wondering if there was a way to change the font and/or color of the list of emails so I can differentiate read emails from unread emails. I can’t always tell the difference between the bold type and the normal, and the green unread dots look just like the gray read dots to me. I wrote an email to support asking for help, and I got a response, but I cannot figure out what the note is telling me. I am not a computer programmer. I called my support service and they are as baffled as I am. I have been very happy with Thunderbird, but I need a little help. Below is the email response I received from my first post. Thank you, George Hutton


david Jan 1, 2023, 4:45:53 AM In config editor set toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true to allow use of the chrome folder. In profile, add folder named chrome (lower-case) In folder, add file named userChrome.css (case-sensitive) In that simple text file, add the following: I set the colors a bit wild, with blue font and yellow background, so please change to your preference. Same goes for size. after saving, thunderbird must be closed and restarted to see changes. Config editor is at settings>general and scroll to bottom. If you want special colors and know the HTML number, replace the blue and yellow with numbers preceded with # (e.g.l, #0000ff is blue, #FF0000 is red. More colors available by web search for html color chart THE FOLLOWING CODE is for userChrome.css: 

/* Make unread messages blue text and italic */ treechildren::-moz-tree-cell-text(unread) {   color: blue !important;    font-style: italic !important;    font-size:  16px;    font-weight: bold !important;  background-color: yellow !important;  }

Avoid support scams. We will never ask you to call or text a phone number or share personal information. Learn more here. Mark it as solved This doesn't solve my problem Browse for unsolved questions and help a Firefox user Solving 1 issue helps up to 1,000 users a day! This email is automatically sent by a robot. Our robot can’t respond to your question, but our forum contributors can! If you want to respond to them, please click here.
creator: GHUTTON446

title: A Way to Speed Up Message Filtering?
content:
I have a lot of message filters. They take a long time to run. Right now there is an individual filter for each sender, directing the message to a subfolder. I am wondering if it would be much faster to use an 'or' condition: "If sender is 'Dr. Jones' or 'NYU Langone' or 'Medicare' move message to Inbox->Health".

Also is there a big timing difference between "sender is..." and "sender contains..."? I usually use "contains" in case a site sends from different user names.

title: Exporting and importing Personal Address Book
content:
I imported some (a lot!) of contact information into my Personal Address Book. I got two exact duplicates for a lot of contacts, which was very annoying.

I thought I would create a corrected version of my Personal Address Book by editing the .csv file. As an experiment I exported my Personal Address Book, and then deleted abook.sqlite, and then imported exactly the same .csv file that had I exported. I lost all of my named lists of respondents, of which I have several dozen.

Fortunately I had saved my original abook.sqlite. I copied it back into the proper place. My named lists of email respondents magically re-appeared. Along with all the duplicated contacts.

How can I import new contacts into my Personal Address Book without duplication and also without losing my named lists? How can I eliminate duplicates from my existing Personal Address Book?

Thanks in advance for any insights into what is going on. I am feeling pretty clueless!
creator: charliep2
